page.title: 08Interview of a Fruit Farmer.
page.content: Mr Arthur Usher turned his farm over to fruit farming in 1963 and after growing a variety of fruits now grows apples only. {Why the change to fruit farming?}It is much less demanding on my time which gives me the opportunity to develop other interests such as being a county councillor.I am very busy at picking time and the English climate is always against you. {How mechanised is your farm?}It is mechanised as far as possible _spraying, box handling etc. {Do you employ casual labour for {picking?}Picking requires casual labour.The problem is that the women who do it with enthusiasm are getting older and their daughters are not interested in picking.I and my family work at picking. {What markets are served?}Dessert
